data.event: The name "Clifton" for the area dates to 1817, when a town by the name, larger in area than the present neighborhood, was laid out along the waterfront.

event.title: housed the original headquarters of the National Institutes of Health (now

data.event: Bayley Seton Hospital, north of Vanderbilt Avenue, was formerly the United States Public Health Service Hospital and housed the original headquarters of the National Institutes of Health (now located in Bethesda, Maryland).

event.title: was located at what is now

data.event: It was located at what is now Townsend Avenue and Tompkins Avenue.

event.title: 1900 the Fox Hills Golf Club encompassed

data.event: In 1900 the Fox Hills Golf Club encompassed the entire area of where the Park Hill Apartments are now.
Many tournaments were held there until the 1920s when it closed.
By the 1950s, it evolved into a middle-class, multi-ethnic community of civil employees including firemen, teachers, and doctors.
